results_summary: The study found that acupressure, applied to specific acupoints (HT7, PC6, SP6), improved sleep quality and secondary outcomes like anxiety, depression, and quality of life, suggesting its potential as a therapeutic intervention for sleep disturbances in older adults.
population_specificity: Older people living in residential aged care facilities in Australia.
effective_dosage: 12-minute acupressure sessions, three times per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether acupressure at the P6 point could effectively manage gagging during dental procedures compared to sham interventions.
results_summary: The study found very low-certainty evidence that acupressure at P6 showed uncertain benefits in reducing gagging and completing dental procedures, with no clear difference compared to sham acupressure in most comparisons. Device-based acupressure showed some promise but results were inconsistent.
population_specificity: Adults and children (aged 4+) undergoing dental treatment.
effective_dosage: Not specified (thumb pressure, device, or sea band at P6 point).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of auricular acupressure alone for treating myopia in children and adolescents.
results_summary: The review found that auricular acupressure was more effective than eye-drops and eye exercises and equally effective as needle acupuncture in slowing myopia progression. However, the study noted the need for higher-quality research with sufficient follow-up.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents with myopia

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of acupressure on childbirth satisfaction and the experience of giving birth in women with full-term pregnancy before the onset of labor.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in total childbirth satisfaction among the acupressure, sham acupressure, and control groups, though the acupressure group had higher satisfaction levels. The acupressure group also reported that their actual birth experience was closest to their expectations compared to the other groups.
population_specificity: 120 pregnant women at 39-40 gestational weeks with no signs of labor onset, divided into acupressure, sham acupressure, and control groups.
effective_dosage: Acupressure points (SP6, BL 60, BL 32) were pressured bilaterally; exact frequency/duration not specified.
study_duration: Intervention timing not explicitly stated, but outcomes were measured 24 hours after delivery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness, suitability, and sustainability of non-pharmacological pain management interventions, including acupressure, for community-dwelling older adults with chronic non-cancer pain.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure, among other interventions, reduced pain intensity in older adults, with net changes ranging from -3.13 to -0.65 on a 0-10 scale. The results suggest non-pharmacological methods like acupressure are effective for pain management in this population.
population_specificity: Community-dwelling older adults over 65 years old with chronic non-cancer pain and mental competence.

study_goal: To test the acceptability and feasibility of self-administered acupressure as an intervention for knee pain in middle-aged and older adults with knee osteoarthritis (KOA).
results_summary: Both self-administered acupressure and knee health education groups showed a decreasing trend in knee pain intensity, with a medium between-group effect size (0.40), though differences were not statistically significant. Secondary outcomes were comparable between groups post-intervention.
population_specificity: Middle-aged and older adults with knee osteoarthritis (KOA).
effective_dosage: Two self-administered acupressure training sessions followed by self-practice for 6 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of aromatherapy and acupressure in improving sleep quality in patients undergoing percutaneous coronary interventions (PCIs).
results_summary: The study found that acupressure significantly improved sleep quality compared to other groups, with a mean posttest score increase of 4.37 (P < 0.001). Placebo acupressure and control groups showed minimal changes.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing percutaneous coronary interventions (PCIs).
effective_dosage: Acupressure was applied from 10 pm to 8 am the following day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of acupressure (SP6) on reducing labor pain and shortening the duration of the first stage of labor.
results_summary: Acupressure on SP6 significantly reduced labor pain and shortened the duration of the first stage of labor compared to touch alone, with higher satisfaction reported in the experimental group.
population_specificity: 60 pregnant women (30 in the experimental group, 30 in the control group) during the active and transition stages of labor.
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied to the SP6 point during each contraction in active and transition stages.
study_duration: Duration of the first stage of labor (experimental group: 4.88 ± 0.85 hours; control group: 5.56 ± 0.66 hours).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evidence for the effect of auricular therapy (a form of acupressure) on blood pressure using meta-analysis methodology.
results_summary: Auricular acupressure combined with antihypertensive drugs was found to be more effective than antihypertensive drugs alone in reducing systolic blood pressure and achieving blood pressure targets. The study systematically reviewed 44 randomized controlled trials involving 5022 patients.
population_specificity: Patients with hypertension.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the global scientific output of acupuncture research on insomnia and explore its research hotspots and trends from 1999 to 2018.
results_summary: The study found a gradual increase in publications on acupuncture for insomnia, with China leading in research output. Systematic reviews and clinical trials focused on electroacupuncture and acupressure, indicating growing acceptance in Asia.
population_specificity: Not specified (global research output analysis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the evidence of acupuncture (including acupressure) on breathlessness severity in patients with advanced malignant and nonmalignant diseases.
results_summary: The meta-analysis showed significant improvements in breathlessness severity (SMD = -1.77, P = 0.007) in patients with advanced diseases, though methodological heterogeneity and low power were noted. Acupuncture demonstrated potential morphine-sparing effects as an add-on therapy.
population_specificity: Adult patients with advanced diseases (347 COPD, 190 advanced cancer) experiencing severe breathlessness.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of auricular seed acupressure and foot reflexology on neonatal abstinence syndrome in neonates of addicted women.
results_summary: Both foot reflexology and auricular seed acupressure significantly reduced abstinence symptoms, with foot reflexology showing greater immediate effects (15-min intervention) and seed acupressure achieving comparable effects after 24 hours.
population_specificity: Neonates of addicted women at risk for neonatal abstinence syndrome.
effective_dosage: Foot reflexology—15 minutes; seed acupressure—24 hours (SJ 17 acupoint).
study_duration: Two successive days with a 12-hour washout interval.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of acupressure in reducing fatigue in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure significantly reduced fatigue in cancer patients after chemotherapy compared to the control group, with a lower mean visual analog score of fatigue in the acupressure group. The effect was short-term and statistically significant.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy (90 participants, divided into three groups of 30 each).
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied at Zusanli (ST-36), Hegu (LI-4), and Sanyingjiao (SP-6) points (specific frequency not mentioned).
study_duration: Intervention administered before, during, and after chemotherapy (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: To determine the effect of acupressure on anxiety and sleep quality in patients after cardiac surgery.
results_summary: Acupressure significantly decreased anxiety levels and improved sleep quality in the intervention group compared to the control group (P < .05). The effects were observed over three postoperative days.
population_specificity: Patients admitted to the surgical clinic after cardiac surgery (3-4 days post-operation).
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied to four different acupoints (specific points not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of auricular acupressure for weight reduction in overweight/obese individuals and explore the relationship between treatment duration and outcomes.
results_summary: Auricular acupressure, alone or combined with diet/exercise, was effective in reducing body weight, BMI, waist circumference, waist-to-hip ratio, body fat mass, and body fat percentage, but not hip circumference. A 12-week intervention showed larger effects compared to shorter durations.
population_specificity: Overweight and/or obese individuals as defined by study authors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of nonpharmacological interventions, including manual acupressure, on depressive symptoms in patients with end-stage renal disease.
results_summary: Manual acupressure was associated with a modest but significant effect on depressive symptoms (-0.26, 95% CI = [-0.50, 0.03]), though fewer studies reported adverse events, limiting safety conclusions.
population_specificity: Patients with end-stage renal disease experiencing depressive symptoms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether acupressure at Sanyinjiao (SP6) could reduce albuminuria in patients with early-stage diabetic nephropathy.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure at Sanyinjiao for 8 weeks reduced albuminuria, particularly in the group receiving acupressure for ≥45 days, compared to the sham and shorter-duration groups. Secondary outcomes like glomerular filtration rate and hemoglobin A1c were not significantly impacted.
population_specificity: 53 patients with diabetic nephropathy and albuminuria.
effective_dosage: Acupressure at Sanyinjiao (SP6); duration split into <45 days (experiment A) and ≥45 days (experiment B).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the preliminary effects of two types of self-administered acupressure (relaxing and stimulating) on fatigue, pain, sleep, and reported disability in individuals with chronic low back pain.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure groups showed a 35-36% reduction in pain compared to usual care, and stimulating acupressure also improved fatigue. Adverse events were minimal and related to excessive pressure application.
population_specificity: Individuals with chronic low back pain (CLBP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect, safety, and cost-effectiveness of auricular acupressure as a complementary therapy for psoriasis vulgaris when combined with standard medication.
results_summary: The study is ongoing, but it is designed to evaluate relapse rate, time to relapse, and other secondary outcomes like Psoriasis Area and Severity Index improvement, with cost-effectiveness analysis planned.
population_specificity: 180 participants with psoriasis vulgaris.
effective_dosage: Auricular acupressure once per week for 4 weeks; calcipotriol betamethasone ointment once daily for 4 weeks.
study_duration: 4 weeks of intervention, with a 12-week follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of auricular acupressure (AA) in treating insulin resistance (IR) in overweight/obese women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
results_summary: The study is a randomized, placebo-controlled pilot trial, but results are not yet available (pre-results). The primary outcome is changes in IR, with secondary outcomes including hormonal profile, weight, and quality of life.
population_specificity: Overweight/obese women with PCOS (n=60).
effective_dosage: Magnetic beads applied to auricular points (specific frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of acupressure on patient-reported postoperative recovery, including quality of recovery, nausea, pain, and opioid consumption.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure did not significantly improve postoperative quality of recovery, nausea, pain scores, or opioid consumption, but it was associated with improved patient satisfaction.
population_specificity: Postoperative patients expected to stay in the hospital for at least 2 days after surgery.
effective_dosage: Pressure applied for 6 minutes (2 minutes per acupoint), three times a day for up to 2 postoperative days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auricular acupressure using vaccaria seeds could reduce obesity-related markers in adolescents.
results_summary: The experimental group showed significant improvements in total cholesterol and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels compared to the control group after 8 weeks of intervention. No significant changes were reported for other obesity-related measures like body weight, BMI, or body-fat percentage.
population_specificity: 58 obese adolescents (32 in the experimental group, 26 in the control group).
effective_dosage: Not specified (auricular acupressure using vaccaria seeds, frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of acupressure on cardiac rhythm, heart rate, and fatigue in patients with atrial fibrillation (AF).
results_summary: Acupressure reduced heart rate and systolic/diastolic blood pressure in AF patients, with repeated administrations showing greater efficacy, but it did not significantly affect fatigue or restore sinus rhythm.
population_specificity: 60 individuals with atrial fibrillation (30 intervention, 30 placebo) in a cardiology service.
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied twice per day (minimum 2, maximum 4 sessions) to specific acupuncture points (PC-6, HT-7, CV-17).
study_duration: Not explicitly stated in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if enhancing patients' expectations could improve the effectiveness of acupressure bands in reducing chemotherapy-induced nausea (CIN) in breast cancer patients.
results_summary: Acupressure bands combined with a relaxation recording reduced CIN in patients receiving doxorubicin or those with high pre-treatment anxiety, but no significant difference was found between expectancy-enhanced and expectancy-neutral interventions.
population_specificity: Chemotherapy-naïve breast cancer patients who expected nausea.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of Power Point Therapy (PPT), a novel reflexology-based approach, with standard physiotherapy in treating subacute low back pain.
results_summary: Both PPT and physiotherapy significantly improved subacute low back pain, with PPT showing likely greater effectiveness, particularly in enhancing health-related quality of life and clinician-assessed outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with subacute low back pain (80 participants, 41 in PPT group, 39 in physiotherapy group).
effective_dosage: 10 units of PPT (10 minutes each) compared to 10 units of physiotherapy (30 minutes each).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of auricular acupressure (AA) in improving acute postoperative pain through a systematic review of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis of 26 studies showed that AA significantly improved the total effective rate for acute postoperative pain compared to conventional therapy, with a risk ratio of 1.25 (95% CI: 1.13–1.37). However, further high-quality RCTs are needed for a more precise effect estimate.
population_specificity: Patients with acute postoperative pain after surgery (1,682 participants across 26 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of acupressure at true acupoints versus sham points in improving sleep quality and reducing psychological distress in older-adult nursing home residents.
results_summary: The experimental group showed significantly greater improvement in sleep quality and lower psychological distress levels compared to the control group, both immediately after the intervention and at 1-month follow-up. The effects were statistically significant and clinically meaningful.
population_specificity: Older-adult nursing home residents with poor sleep quality and psychological distress.
effective_dosage: 20 minutes of acupressure before sleeping, 3 times a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of non-needle acupoint stimulation (such as acupressure) in reducing postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in female patients undergoing breast surgery.
results_summary: Non-needle acupoint stimulation significantly reduced nausea and vomiting within 48 hours post-surgery, though its effect within the first 2 hours was not obvious. Wristband acupressure was associated with more adverse reactions compared to other methods like transcutaneous acupoint electrical stimulation.
population_specificity: Female patients undergoing breast surgery (1,009 participants across 14 randomized controlled trials).
effective_dosage: Transcutaneous acupoint electrical stimulation on PC6 from 30 minutes before anesthesia induction to the end of surgery.
study_duration: From 30 minutes pre-anesthesia to the end of surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and theoretical basis of acupoint-based energy psychology protocols, addressing criticisms and reviewing evidence for their use in treating anxiety, depression, PTSD, and other conditions.
results_summary: The study found that acupoint tapping protocols are rapid and effective for treating anxiety, depression, and PTSD, supported by over 100 peer-reviewed studies, including 51 randomized controlled trials. Mechanisms for these outcomes were also proposed.
population_specificity: Individuals with anxiety, depression, PTSD, and possibly other conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auricular acupressure (AA) improves pain, pain threshold, disability, and cervical range of motion in adults with chronic neck pain.
results_summary: The study found that AA significantly improved pain threshold, neck disability, and cervical range of motion (flexion and left rotation) but did not show significant effects on pain intensity (VAS).
population_specificity: 48 adults with chronic neck pain in South Korea.
effective_dosage: AA applied to specific acupoints for neck pain (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of naturopathic treatments, including acupressure, in managing postoperative issues such as nausea, vomiting, pain, and gastrointestinal dysfunction.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure can reduce postoperative nausea and vomiting as well as pain. No serious side effects were reported in the reviewed publications.
population_specificity: Postoperative patients with issues like nausea, vomiting, pain, and gastrointestinal dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of participant-led self-care techniques, including acupressure, in reducing menstrual pain compared to no treatment or analgesics.
results_summary: Acupressure showed moderate effects in reducing menstrual pain (g = 0.56) but was significantly less effective than exercise and heat compared to analgesics (g = -0.76). The study noted potential bias and non-specific effects influencing findings.
population_specificity: Young women experiencing menstrual pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of self-administered acupressure on sleep quality and fatigue in patients with migraine.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in sleep quality between acupressure and sham acupressure groups, but fatigue significantly decreased in both groups, with a greater reduction in the acupressure group.
population_specificity: Patients with migraine without aura (n=76).
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied thrice weekly at bedtime.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of acupressure in preventing chemotherapy-induced nausea (CIN) in pediatric patients receiving highly emetogenic chemotherapy.
results_summary: Nonwhite race was associated with higher acute-phase nausea severity, while poor acute-phase CIN control, non-CNS cancer diagnosis, and cisplatin administration were linked to higher delayed-phase nausea severity. The study did not explicitly report acupressure's efficacy compared to sham control in the abstract.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients receiving highly emetogenic chemotherapy.
study_duration: Acute phase lasted up to 24 hours post-chemotherapy; delayed phase lasted up to seven days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure, among other methods, could reduce anxiety and depression in patients undergoing haemodialysis.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that acupressure, along with other relaxation techniques, contributes to reducing anxiety and depressive symptoms in haemodialysis patients. However, specific data on acupressure's effectiveness compared to other methods is not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing haemodialysis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate and provide an updated perspective on treatments for primary dysmenorrhea, including acupressure, by reviewing existing literature.
results_summary: Acupressure was found to suppress pain by mechanisms such as reducing prostaglandin levels, mediating nitric oxide, increasing beta-endorphin levels, and enhancing uterine circulatory flow. The study included four papers on acupuncture and acupressure, suggesting potential benefits but calling for further trials to confirm efficacy and safety.
population_specificity: Patients with primary dysmenorrhea (sample sizes ranged from 24 to 303).
study_duration: Treatment duration ranged from one to six months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize studies on the effects of acupressure on sleep quality, depression, anxiety, and agitation in older people and describe the acupressure techniques used.
results_summary: Nine studies showed positive effects on sleep quality, four studies demonstrated reduced depression, while findings on anxiety and agitation were inconsistent. The review suggests acupressure may benefit sleep and psychological wellbeing in older people.
population_specificity: Older people aged 60 years and above

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the benefits and harms of acupuncture and related interventions, including acupressure, compared to sham or active treatments for managing pain and other symptoms of carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS) in adults.
results_summary: The study found that acupuncture and laser acupuncture may have little or no short-term effect on CTS symptoms compared to placebo or sham acupuncture. Evidence was of low certainty, with no serious adverse events reported but some minor side effects like skin bruising and local pain.
population_specificity: Adults with carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS).
study_duration: Outcomes measured at least three weeks after randomization, with some follow-ups up to 13 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to critically analyze published literature on auriculotherapy to assess its effectiveness in managing various health disorders.
results_summary: Auriculotherapy showed positive effects when combined with conventional treatments for insomnia, chronic, and acute pain, but further well-designed studies are needed for other conditions.
population_specificity: Patients with insomnia, smoking cessation needs, and pain (within Neurology, Orthopaedics, and Rheumatology).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of auricular acupressure (AA) therapy in preventing constipation among leukemia patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: AA combined with routine care improved constipation-related outcomes (BSF, CAS, PAC-QOL) but did not show benefits for fatigue, quality of life (EQ-5D), or anxiety/depression (HADS). The study concluded AA may be a safe complementary therapy for constipation prevention in this population.
population_specificity: Leukemia patients undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether noninvasive acupressure could prevent or reduce chemotherapy-induced myelosuppression in gynecologic cancer patients and determine its association with SCF and GM-CSF regulation.
results_summary: Acupressure significantly increased SCF levels, potentially protecting against hemoglobin reduction and myelosuppression. The experimental group showed a borderline higher SCF increase compared to controls, with a significant interactive effect between acupressure and SCF levels.
population_specificity: 28 women with gynecological cancer (10 in the experimental group, 18 in the control group).
effective_dosage: 5-minute acupressure sessions on 8 specific acupoints, three times daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of acupuncture interventions in improving lifestyle risk factors for stroke, including alcohol-dependence, smoking-dependence, hypertension, and obesity.
results_summary: The study found limited evidence supporting acupuncture for smoking-dependence (reduced cigarettes per day) and obesity (reduced waist circumference), but no robust evidence for alcohol-dependence or hypertension. Most trials had a high risk of bias, weakening the reliability of the findings.
population_specificity: Individuals with lifestyle risk factors for stroke (alcohol-dependence, smoking-dependence, hypertension, obesity).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of auricular acupressure (AA) as an adjunct therapy for pain management through a systematic review of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Twelve out of fifteen studies reported statistically significant improvement in pain outcomes (severity and analgesic consumption) with AA compared to sham or standard care. However, the studies had medium methodological quality, and the lack of consistent rigorous methodology limits definitive conclusions on AA's effectiveness.
population_specificity: Hospitalized patients experiencing pain (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auricular acupressure could enhance the efficacy of habit reversal treatment for nail biting by reducing anxiety.
results_summary: Auricular acupressure significantly improved the efficacy of habit reversal treatment, reduced anxiety scores, and improved nail growth and oral health indices compared to placebo.
population_specificity: 83 children aged 8-12 years with nail-biting habits.
study_duration: Two-month washout period between crossover treatments.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the acupressure component of Emotional Freedom Techniques (EFT) was an active ingredient in producing therapeutic outcomes, independent of placebo or other therapy components.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that acupressure groups showed moderately stronger outcomes than controls, with significant effect sizes (Cohen's d = -0.47, Hedges' g = -0.45), indicating that acupressure contributed meaningfully to treatment effects beyond placebo or nonspecific therapy effects.
population_specificity: Adults with diagnosed or self-identified psychological or physical symptoms (n = 403, with 102 in the acupressure-focused analysis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a self-care toolkit (SCT) including acupressure antinausea wristbands could mitigate distress and symptoms in breast cancer patients undergoing surgery.
results_summary: The SCT group showed significant improvements in pain interference, fatigue, and satisfaction with social roles, as well as smaller increases in postoperative pain and inflammatory markers compared to the control group. Clinically significant reductions in anxiety were also observed in the SCT group.
population_specificity: Women with breast cancer planning to undergo initial surgery (n=100).
effective_dosage: Not specified (acupressure wristbands were part of the SCT).
study_duration: Perioperative period (from baseline to ~2 weeks postsurgery).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of acupuncture or acupressure for women with PMS or PMDD compared to sham, usual care, or pharmaceutical interventions.
results_summary: Acupuncture may reduce mood-related and physical PMS symptoms more than sham acupuncture, but evidence quality was low to very low. No significant difference in adverse events was found, though data was insufficient.
population_specificity: Women with PMS, PMDD, or late luteal phase dysphoric disorder (LPDD).
effective_dosage: Number of treatment sessions ranged from seven to 28 (specific frequency not detailed).
study_duration: Not explicitly stated (session range implies variable duration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of acupressure on preoperative anxiety in cesarean section candidates.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure at the Yintang and HE-7 acupoints significantly reduced preoperative anxiety compared to sham acupressure, with a statistically significant difference in mean anxiety scores post-intervention.
population_specificity: 60 pregnant women scheduled for cesarean section.
effective_dosage: Simultaneous acupressure at Yintang and HE-7 acupoints for 5 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility, acceptability, and effectiveness of auricular point acupressure (APA) in reducing sleep disturbance among women with ovarian cancer undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: APA treatment significantly improved sleep quality, with a 65% reduction in sleep disturbance after 4 weeks and a further 10% decrease after 6 weeks, compared to controls receiving only sleep hygiene practices. Participants found the procedure easy to perform, supporting its feasibility for broader study.
population_specificity: Women with ovarian cancer undergoing chemotherapy at a publicly funded hospital in southern Taiwan.
effective_dosage: Gentle fingertip pressure at acupoints on the external ear (specific frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of auricular acupressure (AA) therapy in preventing constipation among leukemia patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found weak evidence supporting AA's effectiveness in preventing constipation, with improvements in stool form but low methodological quality across included trials.
population_specificity: Leukemia patients undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test whether acupressure could reduce dental anxiety in children undergoing scaling and restorative dental procedures.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure significantly reduced anxiety levels in children, as measured by the Modified Child Dental Anxiety Scale (MCDAS), pulse rate, and Frankl behavior ratings, compared to sham and control groups.
population_specificity: Children aged 8-12 years undergoing dental scaling and/or restorative procedures.
effective_dosage: Not specified (acupressure beads with adhesive strips were used over selected acupoints).
study_duration: Duration of the dental procedure (not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of acupressure on glycemic control and insulin requirements in females with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM).
results_summary: The study found that acupressure, combined with standard antenatal care, significantly reduced OGTT results, insulin resistance, and insulin requirements within groups, but no significant differences were observed between the acupressure and control groups at 24 and 36 weeks' gestation. Neonatal and pregnancy outcomes were also similar between groups.
population_specificity: Thirty female patients with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of acupressure wristbands on the P6 acupoint in preventing postoperative nausea and vomiting and reducing antiemetic drug requirements in high-risk patients undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
results_summary: Acupressure wristbands reduced nausea severity at the 2nd postoperative hour and incidence between 2-6 hours compared to placebo, but showed no significant difference versus the control group. No clinical effectiveness was found for reducing vomiting, antiemetic use, pain, anxiety, or analgesic needs.
population_specificity: 111 female patients undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
effective_dosage: Acupressure wristband applied to the P6 acupoint.
study_duration: Wristband placed 1 hour before surgery and removed 6 hours after surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure on foot acupoints (KI-1) improves sleep quality and overall quality of life in hemodialysis patients with CKD-associated pruritus.
results_summary: The study assessed acupressure's effects on sleep quality and quality of life using standardized scales (5D itch scale, PSQI, EQ-5D 3L), but specific efficacy results were not detailed in the abstract. The intervention was compared against zolpidem 10 mg, with assessments at weeks 4 and 8.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients with CKD-associated pruritus and sleep disturbances in Pakistan.
effective_dosage: Acupressure applied to both feet on KI-1 acupoints for a total of 6 minutes (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of acupuncture and acupressure in preventing menstrual migraine (MM) and assess their safety as prophylactic interventions.
results_summary: Both verum acupuncture and acupressure were significantly more effective than control acupuncture in reducing MM days and peak pain during the intervention period, but no significant differences were observed during follow-up. No serious adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: Females with menstrual migraine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of acupuncture and acupressure in treating uremic pruritus in patients with end-stage renal disease.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that acupuncture or acupressure was effective in treating uremic pruritus, with a pooled mean difference of -1.994 (95% CI: -2.544 to -1.445). However, only 3 out of 6 trials used a visual analogue scale for assessment, indicating some variability in study methods.
population_specificity: Patients with end-stage renal disease suffering from uremic pruritus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the current evidence of auricular therapy (specifically auricular acupressure) on lactation outcomes, including its effectiveness, intervention protocols, and clinical applicability.
results_summary: The study found that auricular therapy, particularly auricular acupressure with vaccaria seeds, was associated with earlier onset of lactation and reduced risk of low milk production compared to routine care. Standardized mean differences in serum prolactin levels generally favored auricular therapy, indicating better lactation outcomes.
population_specificity: Postpartum mothers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of auricular acupressure therapy (AAT) for improving sleep quality in maintenance hemodialysis (MHD) patients with insomnia.
results_summary: The study design suggests favorable preliminary results from prior AAT applications, but the abstract does not report final outcomes. The primary endpoint is clinical response rate (PSQI score reduction ≥3) at 8 weeks, with secondary endpoints including changes in PSQI scores and hypnotics usage over time.
population_specificity: Maintenance hemodialysis (MHD) patients with insomnia from six hemodialysis centers in Guangzhou, China.
effective_dosage: Not specified (auricular acupressure applied to active or control points for 8 weeks).
study_duration: 8 weeks of intervention, followed by a 12-week follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of acupressure on pain intensity, anxiety, and physiological indexes in cancer patients undergoing bone marrow biopsy and aspiration.
results_summary: Acupressure resulted in the lowest average anxiety and pain scores compared to sham pressure and no intervention, with statistically significant differences (P = 0.01 for anxiety, P = 0.001 for pain). The method was noted as cost-effective and clinically useful.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing bone marrow biopsy and aspiration.
effective_dosage: Not specified (LI4 and HT7 acupressure points were used).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of smartphone app-based self-acupressure in reducing menstrual pain compared to usual care in women with primary dysmenorrhea.
results_summary: App-based self-acupressure significantly reduced mean pain intensity, worst pain intensity, and days with pain compared to usual care, with effects increasing over time. Responder rates were higher in the acupressure group, and the intervention was safe with good adherence.
population_specificity: Women aged 18-34 years in Berlin, Germany, with self-reported menstrual pain of 6 or more on a numeric rating scale.
effective_dosage: Not specified (self-administered via app for 6 consecutive menstruation cycles).

study_goal: To evaluate the effects and safety of acupressure for managing respiratory allergic diseases (allergic rhinitis and asthma) by reviewing randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Acupressure showed greater relief of nasal symptoms in allergic rhinitis compared to ephedrine nasal drops plus thermal therapy. For asthma, one study found acupressure plus salbutamol improved pulmonary function more than salbutamol alone, but two other studies found no significant differences.
population_specificity: Patients with allergic rhinitis or asthma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of complementary and alternative therapies, including acupressure, as an alternative or adjunctive method for managing acute and chronic pain.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that evidence-based complementary and alternative therapies, including acupressure, are effective in managing acute and chronic pain, offering benefits in pain reduction and quality of life enhancement. However, specific results for acupressure alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general mention of patients with acute or chronic pain).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness and safety of acupressure for third trimester cervical ripening or induction of labour.
results_summary: The study found no clear benefit from acupressure in reducing caesarean section rates or other primary outcomes compared to sham control or usual care. Some evidence suggested potential benefits in cervical maturation, but results were inconsistent and limited by study quality.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in the third trimester (3456 women across 22 trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure reduces agitation and salivary cortisol levels in people with dementia.
results_summary: Acupressure showed a downward trend in agitation, nearly reaching significance, and significantly reduced agitation at the 5th week compared to baseline. It also effectively reduced salivary cortisol levels.
population_specificity: 119 agitated residents with dementia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a simple acupressure protocol at LIV3 and LI4 acupoints in reducing pain and improving quality of life in women with primary dysmenorrhea.
results_summary: The study found that acupressure significantly reduced the intensity and duration of dysmenorrhea pain in the second and third menstrual cycles, and improved most domains of quality of life, except for certain mental health components.
population_specificity: 90 young women with primary dysmenorrhea.
effective_dosage: 20 minutes of acupressure daily at LIV3 or LI4 acupoints, or placebo points.
study_duration: Five days before menstruation for three successive menstrual cycles.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of acupuncture in relieving distressing symptoms in palliative care through a three-arm randomized controlled trial.
results_summary: The study designed treatment protocols for acupuncture and medical symptom control to ensure comparability and symptom relief, but specific efficacy results were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients in palliative care experiencing dyspnea, pruritus, hypersalivation, depression, anxiety, and xerostomia.

study_goal: To investigate whether acupressure reduces fatigue in female nurses with chronic back pain.
results_summary: Acupressure significantly reduced fatigue severity in the experimental group compared to the sham group immediately after, 2 weeks, and 4 weeks post-intervention. The study concluded that acupressure is an effective, low-cost, drug-free method to improve fatigue in this population.
population_specificity: Female nurses with chronic back pain working in selected hospitals in Isfahan, Iran.
effective_dosage: 9 sessions, 3 times a week for 14 minutes per session.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acupressure at the P6 point could reduce postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) in high-risk ambulatory surgical patients.
results_summary: Acupressure at the P6 point significantly reduced PONV across all postoperative phases. The study concluded that acupressure is an effective, low-risk, and low-cost adjunctive therapy for high-risk PONV patients.
population_specificity: Ambulatory surgical patients identified as high risk for PONV (female, PONV history or motion sickness, nonsmoker, and volatile gas general anesthetic).
effective_dosage: Acupressure bead patch applied preoperatively (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether acupressure combined with sodium valproate (ASV) is more effective than sodium valproate alone (SV) in preventing chronic migraine with aura (CMA).
results_summary: ASV did not outperform SV in pain relief, migraine attack frequency, analgesic use, or quality of life but significantly reduced nausea compared to SV.
population_specificity: 98 patients with chronic migraine with aura (CMA).
